attributes.action: Compulsary Training on NeuroDevelopment Conditions for all School Staff
attributes.background: Early intervention can have a significant effect on quality of life and is one of the keys to success for children with neurodevelopment conditions (3-4% of children in England) including, ASD, HFA, sensory processing difficulties, ADHD, dyslexia, dyspraxia, dyscalculia, dysgraphia and FragileX
attributes.additional_details:
Compulsory training would not only raise awareness of signs and syptoms and equip staff with the tools to empathise but could also result in earlier assessment, improving childrens well-being and prevent poor mental health in adolescence.
'early identification of impairments and conditions may allow children to receive specialist care services at an early stage, improving outcomes and preventing severe disability and sometimes death.' (Broach, S. et al (2010).
attributes.creator_name: catherine williams kireece welch brenda hill

attributes.action: Change the level on B12 blood test as it is set too low
attributes.background:
At present the serum level for B12 is not included with regular blood work and is set too low
This means that people with debilitating symptoms get ignored with little or no treatment for chronic pain and nerve damage.
attributes.additional_details:
Some die others will be wheelchair and housebound needlessly.
All that we need is for the serum level to be reset under 200 to 550 as a standard just as Say iron is essential and set so is B12 .
This simple steps would mean million of lives saved from nerve damage and millions of needless medical expenses saved

attributes.action: Stop the Assad regime's airstrikes on civilians and hospitals.
attributes.background:
Deliberate, systematic targeting of civilians, medical facilities and humanitarian workers in opposition held areas of Syria by Russian and Assad regime airstrikes are war crimes.

www.amnesty.org/en/press-releases/2016/03/syrian-and-russian-forces-targeting-hospitals-as-a-strategy-of-war/
attributes.additional_details: The Assad regime and its allies have broken the Cessation of Hostilities agreement just as they have flouted every UNSC resolution on Syria. Peace talks and words of condemnation are meaningless so long as Assad continues to murder populations with impunity. We call on the UK to give Assad an ultamitum to cease airstrikes. In the case of non-compliance, we call on the UK to eliminate Assad's air force through military action, and pressure Russia to halt its own attacks.

attributes.action: Prominently debate BASIC INCOME Early Day Motion 974 (Session: 2015-16).
attributes.background: Caroline Lucas created BASIC INCOME EDM 974. Jonathan Reynolds similarly supports basic income. John McDonnell said Labour are considering basic income. Basic income trials are set to take place in Canada, Finland, and Holland. The time is ripe for UK Parliament to debate EDM 974 BASIC INCOME.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.parliament.uk/edm/2015-16/974

http://www.newstatesman.com/politics/welfare/2016/02/how-i-learnt-stop-worrying-and-love-basic-income

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/dec/26/dutch-city-utrecht-basic-income-uk-greens
Early day motion 974 - BASIC INCOME
That this House notes the growing crisis of low pay and precarity in a labour market increasingly characterised by casualised forms of employment that offer...
parliament.uk

attributes.action: Amend Merchant Shipping act to ensure foreign seamen sit full oral exams at MCA.
attributes.background: More foreign seamen are being given a Cert. of Equivalent Competency by our MCA every year in the UK, than our total of native born Mariners. The exam is basic, and not the full exam a British seafarer must sit for their Certificate of Competency. It's unsafe, unfair, & an immoral double standard.
attributes.additional_details: Other countries which benefit from strict cabotage laws restricting these practices include the USA, Australia, Canada, & others. The UN's International Maritime Organization based in London has been used to create STCW regulations which force British flagged ships to accept member nations maritime education credentials as equal to British ones. This was done to break the power of unions in the 70/80s. The result is a stagnation of efficiency and safety for 20 years, putting our shores at risk.

attributes.action: Remove the "Disrespect NoBody" ad across all platforms (TV, Radio, Ect.)
attributes.background: The UK Government backed and funded the "Disrespect NoBody" campaign. The campaign video doesn't acknowledge that men can be the one experiencing abuse in a relationship and uses key phrases like "Do you turn to violence when your GIRLFRIEND disagrees with you" Link to ad http://youtu.be/V9GjpheIMro
attributes.additional_details: I am a 16 year old male currently studying for my GCSE's in my last year of high school. I had came across this advert whilst watching some TV and I thought nothing but I heard it again that same day and noticed it doesn't acknowledge the fact that men can receive abuse in relationships also. I again heard it on the radio in the car and asked my Dad if there is something I can do about it, he didn't really give too much help so I've done a bit of research and decided to start a petition.

attributes.action: Get full labeling on ALL goods regarding animal ingredients or use in production
attributes.background: I want to have labeling that discloses if manufactured goods contain animal ingredients or have used animal ingredients in the manufacturing process.  A simple declaration that there IS or IS NOT any animal ingredient or derivative used at any stage of manufacture.  Large enough to be easily read.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like it made mandatory that all products ie, tyre, decorating materials, household cleaners, garden products, clothes and footwear, to be clearly marked that they contain animal derivatives such as tallow, gelatine, animal based glues, and shellac.
People may be unaware that by buying a product they assume to be cruelty free is in fact derived from the meat or dairy industry.
Under this new labeling regulation products would immediately be transparent in their mode of manufacture.

attributes.action: Introduce joint sponsorship for partner settlement visas
attributes.background: Non-EU citizens wishing to live with their fiancé or spouse in the UK must have their application sponsored by their partner alone. If their partner does not meet the financial requirement, the couple cannot live together in the UK. Joint sponsorship would allow this responsibility to be shared.
attributes.additional_details:
Joint sponsorship, as applied in other countries (such as the USA), allows a second individual to accept legal responsibility for supporting the visa applicant throughout the duration of their visa. 

Such a system would provide couples those who are unable to meet the strict financial requirements of sponsorship a way to live together in the UK, without the the additional risk to the taxpayer that reducing the financial requirement may have.

attributes.action: Ban ride sharing scheme known as 'pooling' for passenger's and driver's safety.
attributes.background: To improve safety of passengers vehicle sharing schemes like 'pooling' should be banned as you never know who will be next person sharing vehicle with you. Would you like to share a vehicle with a stranger? Female going home with stanger? Help London being safer place.
attributes.additional_details:
Pool ride has been advertised as cheaper option of Regular ride but litte do passengers know that means longer journey while driver is stopping to wait for next rider that requested pool ride. If driver does not stop is facing possible deactivation from platform and if does is facing low rating by riders which is leading also to deactivation from platform.
Both ways, driver is facing issues and rider safety is compromised.

attributes.action: Save HMS President 1918
attributes.background: HMS President Preservation Trust, the charity that owns HMS President 1918, London's last remaining World War One ship, and one of only three left has been refused Lottery funding of £330,000 to secure its future and may result in her being scrapped.
attributes.additional_details:
During WW1 HMS President 1918 was a secret German U Boat Submarine hunter (a 'Q ship') shadowing the Atlantic convoys with concealed guns. In WW2 She was used to protect St Paul's Cathedral from the Luftwaffe.

The Charity's last resort is an appeal and application to The Treasury for Government funding and it is hoped that our new Chancellor, Philip Hammond who was previously Defence Secretary and aware of the importance of The President to the nation and military, will now step in and save her.

attributes.action: Parents of British children must be exempt from No Recourse To Public Funds
attributes.background: Some British children are being denied  a better accommodation and basic benefits as a result of the Home Office Restrictions on their parents (No Recourse To Public Funds)
attributes.additional_details: As part of the Home Office Limited Leave to Remain conditions, there are thousands of British Nationals (Children) being treated badly due to the inhumane Immigration policy made by the Home office to impose No Recourse To Public Funds on their parents.

attributes.action: Stop any more government and public service contracts from being awarded to G4S
attributes.background: All companies being awarded government contracts should show a completely unblemished record in every area of their operations. These are sensitive and privileged contracts.

attributes.action: Introduce emergency legislation to keep the London Stock Exchange British
attributes.background: The London Stock Exchange is vital to British national interests, but is vulnerable to effective take-over by foreign interests, It must be protected and placed on a list of strategically important companies that can not be sold.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on Trident Renewal on the 23rd of June
attributes.background: Let the public have their say on the Renewal of the UK Trident Nuclear Programme

attributes.action: Remove EU flags from public buildings immediately because of the EU result.
attributes.background: We, the people of the UK, have decided to remove ourselves from the European Union via a referendum. We now demand the removal of the symbol of the EU, namely their flag, to be removed from all public buildings with immediate effect.

attributes.action: British people want equal rights to enter the UK with their family
attributes.background:
Citizens from the UAE, Oman & Qatar can travel to the UK with an Electronic Visa Waiver (EVW) document.
British citizens living and working outside of the UK require a visa to return with their non-EU or EEA family, which is often denied.
attributes.additional_details:
Immigration rule 'has split 15,000 children from a parent'
Dominic Casciani BBC News 2015

Families 'torn apart' by immigration rules on spouses
BBC News 2014

UK's new visa rules 'causing anguish' for families
BBC News 2013

attributes.action: Goverment to make it law all assessments on behalf of the DWP be voice recorded
attributes.background: Due to the amount of assessments being overturned by the tribunal that are carried out on behalf of the DWP,If they are all recorded on a machine that will/can record voice then there can be no mistakes made as to what was said at the  interview and in the long run this will save tax payers money.
attributes.additional_details:
i and many others have had a bad time with company`s that do medical assessments for the DWP many times what has been written in the assessment the claiment says is wrong so if all interviews are voice recorded this would eliminate incorrect  evidance
the claiment should be allowed to supply there own voice recording equipment and record the interview
in my own case i had an interview at home and 4 mths later was booked another one company lied and said no one had been to see me i won my case

attributes.action: Ban all premium rate phone numbers for local and national Government services
attributes.background: The DWP have announced that their benefits helpline will be an 0345 number which will cost up to 12p/minute from landlines and up to 45p/minute from mobiles after pledging in 2013 to abolish premium rate numbers for their services.
attributes.additional_details:
This means that a typical 40 minute phone call would cost £18 from a mobile phone. Local and national Government must not target those who are most in need of help and make assistance easily available to those who need it. 

https://www.gov.uk/disability-benefits-helpline
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/claim-benefits-helpline-number-dwp-universal-credit-45p-a-minute-premium-rate-iain-duncan-smith-a6881441.html
http://www.carersoxfordshire.org.uk/cms/content/information-and-advice

attributes.action: Please UK government send aid packages to Fiji after Cyclone Winston
attributes.background: Fiji was recently hit by Cyclone Winston which left much devastation. People have lost lives and many are without homes or water. Fiji is part of the Common Wealth and has ties to the UK with many of our Soldiers being of Fijian nationality. We need to show care by providing aid packages to Fiji.
attributes.additional_details: There has been aid provided by other countries, but more aid is needed and we have more reasons than many to be sending aid.

attributes.action: Declassify and Remove D Notices on All Files of Crimes Against Children
attributes.background: All files and records pertaining to crimes against children (past and present) to have D Notices removed and declassified.
attributes.additional_details: All files and records pertaining to crimes against children (past and present) to have D Notices removed and declassified  to allow those to apply for records seeking legal recourse.  There should be no exclusion to any in the establishment who have committed a crime against children, as it brings into confllict with immediacy existing policy, laws and legislation.  Also, records shared with other global agencies of this nature.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement that all Primary School Teachers are First Aid Trained.
attributes.background:
Implement First Aid Training into Teacher Training Courses at universities and schools. 

Make First Aid Training a prerequisite for any person before they become a Qualified Teacher and are left in charge of a class of up to 30 children alone, between the ages of 4 and 11.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no legislation stating a minimum number of First Aid trained staff in a primary school. 

Currently it is up to the Governors and Head Teacher to carry out a risk assessment, based on the outlay of the school, students, staff and other factors, as to how many members of staff they need to be First Aid trained. 

Class Teachers are left alone with up to 30 children in their care, yet there is no legislation stating that they need to have had any previous First Aid Training.

attributes.action: STOP HIV NOW - Reinstate NHS plans to provide life saving PrEP to all at risk
attributes.background:
Following the Budget the NHS unexpectedly scrapped plans to provide HIV preventing PrEP; limiting access to a handful of people and leaving thousands of young & vulnerable people at risk. 

ACT NOW to reverse the decision. Together, we CAN stop the spread of HIV & provide PrEP to ALL those at risk
attributes.additional_details:
WRITE TO YOUR MP - STOP HIV NOW
https://www.writetothem.com/

http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2016/03/21/nhs-abandons-roll-out-of-hiv-preventing-prep-drugs/

http://www.whatisprep.org/
https://www.gmfa.org.uk/prep
http://www.cdc.gov/hiv/basics/prep.html

WHO studies, recommendations and information on verifying PrEPs effectiveness
http://www.who.int/hiv/pub/prep/en/

Additional information and links to HIV organisations, campaigns and support groups:
http://www.dynamicunity.org/general/stop-hiv-now

attributes.action: Take the lead in bringing internationally mandated prosecutions against SriLanka
attributes.background: We the undersigned urge the British government to take the lead in bringing internationally mandated prosecutions against former and serving officials of the Sri Lankan state for the crimes of genocide, war crimes and crimes against humanity committed against the Tamils.
attributes.additional_details:
In the last stages of the armed conflict in Sri Lanka, 146, 679 Tamils became unaccounted for - either massacred or ‘disappeared’ by the Sri Lankan armed forces.

The UN announced in September 2015 that if established before a court of law, Sri Lanka’s actions may amount to war crimes and/or crimes against humanity. Subsequently, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights noted that if independent trials were to take place, a court of law may even find Sri Lanka guilty of committing genocide.

attributes.action: Make carbon monoxide testers mandatory in GP surgeries
attributes.background:
We call upon the government to make near patient breath testing devices mandatory in GP practices on the following grounds.
Around 50 people die annually in the UK from carbon monoxide poisoning
CO incidents also send thousands more to hospital every year
Testing kits will save lives
attributes.additional_details:
Carbon monoxide can strike anywhere, but those most at risk are the vulnerable in our society - the young, the elderly, those with pre-existing medical conditions.

However, what is unclear is how many victims are turning first to their family doctor for help from the 'silent killer'.

As front line protectors of the nation's health, GPs must be armed with the tools to swiftly diagnose, and therefore prevent, carbon monoxide poisoning.

Only a small percentage of GP surgeries - about one in five - have the necessary equipment to test for carbon monoxide levels in patients.

These devices cost less than £200 each and will save lives.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of Castle Armoury Bury.
attributes.background: Castle Armoury is a Grade II listed building and is currently occupied by a Platoon of Fusiliers. For over 100 years the building has been in use by Fusiliers in their home town of Bury. We believe that so long as their are Fusiliers in Bury, Castle Armoury should be their home.
attributes.additional_details: Plans have recently been announced that after 100 years of continuous use Castle Armoury is to be sold. The occupying Fusilier Platoon is to be moved to a as yet unannounced location along with the Army and Air Cadets. Since before the start of the First World War the building has been occupied by the Fusiliers and stands as the final link between Fusiliers of the present and those who went away to war never to return. The building is still in use and occupied by serving soldiers.

attributes.action: Formation of an independent public inquiry into the governments 7 day NHS plans.
attributes.background: The enforcement of the junior doctors contract shows how little respect the government has for the staff and patients of the NHS. The 7 day NHS plan from the conservative government has inadequate planning / resources and is based on the mis-representation of the weekend mortality statistics.
attributes.additional_details: They are attempting to spread the current NHS workforce across 7 days and so weaken the service provided from Monday - Friday. The imposition of the contract on the junior doctors is simply a way of saving money. The government is going after all those who work in the NHS and morale has never been so low. The governments 7 day NHS plan is completely flawed as it provides no real additional staffing and an independent public inquiry would prove they do not have a workable and safe plan.

attributes.action: Stop TV licensing!
attributes.background: Stop UK residents from being forced to pay for TV licensing!
attributes.additional_details:
It is unfair to tax every household within the UK to fund an organisation such as the BBC.
The people who dont wish to watch the BBC have to pay for it.
If a person already subscibes to cable or satellite then they pay twice for the service. No other service in the Uk is allowed to get away with blanket charges to every household whether or not consumers use their service!

attributes.action: Art50: Wait for a proposal from the EU on reform, before triggering Article 50.
attributes.background:
Art50 Petition: How to tame the Brexit madness.

People in Britain and Europe are angry with their governments. Frexit or Nexit would tear the financial, economic and political fabric of Europe apart, inflicting further damage on people’s lives.

Stop the Brexit madness! Sign the Art50 Petition!
attributes.additional_details:
UK should request EU proposals on:

- Making EU institutions directly accountable to voters
- Improving cooperation where needed, while protecting national sovereignty 
- Creating a dynamic EU economy, with inclusive growth for all citizens
- Concrete steps to stabilize the Euro, while protecting non-Eurozone

Britain shall request no special treatment as part of the reform. 

A second Brexit referendum can be held after EU reform proposals. Only trigger Article 50 after a second Leave vote.

attributes.action: Make Washington Tyne & Wear independent from Sunderland City Council
attributes.background: Since Sunderland City Council took over Washington Development Corporation they have used our money to pay for upgrades and improvements to Mowbray Park, Barnes Park, the City Centre and we in Washington are being left out in the cold. Our public services have been cut severely. Take back control
attributes.additional_details: Facebook group Washington in Decline has seen the addition of almost 1,600 member in the last 2 days. Residents from around Washington are uniting in this common cause to stop the rot. Photographs of the litter, the overflowing bins, the fly tipping,  the overgrowing trees and shrubbery and the grass verges along our roads and highways that are causing disruprion and becoming a danger to motorists. We need to stop this NOW. We need an independent voice and independent Council!!

attributes.action: Stop Government using advertising on Gov sites to promote  'Remain in Europe '.
attributes.background: Their action falls under Purdah rules which prohibit Ministers, Departments and local authorities from publishing any promotional material arguing for, or against any particular outcome or any of the issues involved in the Referendum. The Government know the 28 day rule but intend to 'flaunt it' !
attributes.additional_details:
The Government can only issue facts not suppositions or concocted figures to support their views in trying to influence the outcome of the vote. They tried on 9th September 2015 to change the rules specifically for the referendum but were defeated. Certain Gov't members/supporters of the Remain campaign are using any and every method possible to influence the electorate to vote to remain.
This is a serious breach of existing Rules and must result in immediate removal from office.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election if the result of the EU Referendum is to LEAVE the EU.
attributes.background:
If the British people vote against the Conservative Government's recommendation to stay in the EU, then this should be taken as a vote of no confidence by the British People in the current government.

In this case we call on our elected MPs to pass a resolution to hold an early general election.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 2 of the Fixed-Term Parliaments Act 2012 states:

An early general election is held if:

If the House of Commons resolves "That this house has no confidence in Her Majesty's Government"; or

If the House of Commons, with the support of two-thirds of its total membership (including vacant seats), resolves "That there shall be an early general election"

In either of these two cases, the Monarch appoints the date of the new election by proclamation.

attributes.action: DVLA to create a driving test specific to the geared scooter at 210cc limit
attributes.background: Scooterists are having to learn on large powered motorcycles in order to access an additional 85cc only. Not only is the training irrelevant, but subjects the rider to risks outside those which he chose to engage to road on a scooter. Training should be relevant to the end purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Scooter enthusiasts are having to ride motorcycles to pass their test. As a result, many take a CBT biannually, which is increasing in cost exponentially. 2014 £50 with hire 2016 £100-120 with hire

Petition sponsored by Scooter Workshop Community

attributes.action: Recognise the importance of gardening and horticulture
attributes.background: We call on the Government to recognise the importance of gardening and horticulture, not just to the UK economy, but to the health and wellbeing of people, and ask for policies to recognise its importance across all relevant Government departments.
attributes.additional_details: There is a growing body of evidence to suggest that gardening has health and wellbeing benefits, both in terms of physical activity to being beneficial to suffers of mental health issues. These benefits cut across all age ranges, from young people learning about healthy eating and where our food comes from through "growing their own" to older generations benefiting from regular physical activity which has beneficial implication in terms of mental and physical wellbeing.

attributes.action: Change the law to bar convicted sex offenders from local council service.
attributes.background:
We believe that convicted sex offenders should be barred from holding public office as either a Parish Councillor or Local Authority Councillor.
As the law stands, a convicted sex offender cannot be forced to resign. 
We believe this is wrong & once convicted of a crime, sex offenders must resign.
attributes.additional_details:
Last year a parish Councillor was found guilty in Court of downloading more than 400 indecent images from a website.
Despite public pressure, the councillor has refused to resign.
The local MP for the area has been pushing the Government for a change in the law.
It is important that the law is changed so, in future, convicted sex offenders would not have the opportunity to hold public office once they had been convicted.

attributes.action: Support individuals with Electrosensitivity and Multiple Chemical Sensitivity
attributes.background: We call on the UK Government, the NHS, and other official organisations/agencies, to recognise and support individuals with Electromagnetic Hypersensitivity (EHS) and Multiple Chemical Sensitivity (MCS), and to implement the recommendations outlined in the following documents as quickly as possible:
attributes.additional_details:
PACE Resolution 1815

http://assembly.coe.int/nw/xml/XRef/Xref-XML2HTML-en.asp?fileid=17994&

International EMF Scientist Appeal

https://www.emfscientist.org/

2015 Brussels International Scientific Declaration on Electromagnetic Hypersensitivity and Multiple Chemical Sensitivity 

http://eceri-institute.org/fichiers/1441982765_Statement_EN_DEFINITIF.pdf

Professor Dominique Belpomme paper

http://www.degruyter.com/view/j/reveh.2015.30.issue-4/reveh-2015-0027/reveh-2015-0027.xml?format=INT

attributes.action: Stop further public funds being used to set out the case for remaining in the EU
attributes.background: The recent distribution of literature at a cost of over £9 Million, making the case for the UK to remain in the EU, undermines the Electoral Commissions objectives of the Referendum and demonstrates a lack of integrity by the Government. We believe voters deserve a fair referendum
attributes.additional_details: The Electoral commission has put a spending limit of £7 million for each of the designated Lead campaign groups (Remain or Leave) in the EU referendum. This has been designed to make the case fair for both sides. By Spending £9.2 million the Government have clearly shown bias using Tax Payers funds. We, the petitioners, request the Government to prevent future tax payer funds, from any source, UK or EU, being used to make the case for the UK remaining in the EU.

attributes.action: Amend Official Secrets Act to prohibit its use in cases involving child abuse
attributes.background: Over several decades the Official Secrets Act has been misused to protect paedophiles in positions of power. This is contrary to the public interest and we call on the government to amend the act to ensure that this can not happen again.

attributes.action: EU nationals to apply for British Citizenship for free
attributes.background: Future Brexit negotiations, might restrict the rights of EU nationals to continue living and working in the UK. By allowing free citizenship applications UK Government can put this right, avoiding discrimination against those with low income. Applications should be accepted until 23 June 2022.
attributes.additional_details: By facilitating EU nationals to acquire British citizenship, UK Government has the opportunity to counteract the inability of EU nationals living and working in the UK to vote at the latest Referendum. Additionally, UK Government, by allowing free citizenship applications from EU nationals, will also send a strong message to those who wants to divide our society that UK is a truly tolerant country which values those who contribute to its prosperity.

attributes.action: Restrict all dog breeding establishments to a maximum of 5 litters per year
attributes.background: The Panorama programme on BBC1 highlighted the horror of puppy farming. These people own hundreds of dogs and make vast sums of money from breeding puppies, many of whom are sick or have inherited conditions. Restricting all breeding establishments to 5 litters a year will eradicate puppy farms.
attributes.additional_details: There is a wealth of evidence on puppy farming and that local authorities are routinely granting licences to establishments that are churning out puppies that are sick, have inherited conditions and behaviours issues due to the limited human contact and the conditions they are raised in.

attributes.action: Charge non-resident parents who evade child support payments with child neglect.
attributes.background:
Current legislation does not recognise non-payment of child support as neglect. After a year of non-compliance separate criminal charges should be brought against such non-resident parents for child neglect.

Resident parents should also be able to prosecute non-compliant NRP for financial abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Figures from 2011 indicate that 95.2% of parents who approached the Child Support Agency in order to access their legal entitlement for child maintenance were female. The failure to collect rates are astonishing. It is therefore a gender inequality issue.
This  social injustice needs to be urgently addressed.The far reaching repercussions have to be legally recognised for both the parent with care and the child/ren when one parent fails to support their child/ren.
It is neglect and abuse.

attributes.action: Replace the Wheelchair Symbol with a modern non-disability specific image.
attributes.background: The International Symbol of Access (ISA), also known as the (International) Wheelchair Symbol, was originally designed in 1968. This pre-dates current UK disability law by half a century and, while internationally recognised, is outdated in respect peoples understandings of/and types of disability.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets, shopping centres, stadiums, recreation centres - all of these are public places where many witness what they deem 'abuse' of Disabled Parking bays and/or Accessible Toilets. People become very indignant if people using either are not wheelchair users. It causes a negative view, which later becomes compounded by repeated accusations of, for example, benefit scroungers. Change the symbol. Produce communications that explain the reason for the change. Educate. Tackle discrimination.

attributes.action: Compel councils to provide Aires within their towns for the use of Motorhomes.
attributes.background:
In much of the EU. MOTORHOMES are seen as a help to the local economy and are provided with spaces to park in towns, and villages 
In the UK this is not done and local authorities are now bringing in blanket bans on these types of vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: Spain, France, Portugal and Germany have these Aires or Stellenplatz,only the UK does not. An Aire is an area in a carpark or community centre for example where Motorhomes can park for a period up to 24 hours. If we are truly part of Europe why do we not have the same areas provided by councils in this country. European governments understand that by allowing Motorhome to park they are encouraging people to visit their country which boosts their economy of nearby shops and restaurants.

attributes.action: Provide a decent standard of maintenance for Armed Forces family accommodation.
attributes.background:
The current contractor, CarillionAmey, is failing in its obligations to maintain the accommodation provided for our armed forces personnel.
Our servicemen and women's families are being left for months on end with serious faults including broken boilers, damp, mould and pest infestations.
attributes.additional_details:
These families are spending months without central heating, relying on a couple of tiny fan heaters to heat an entire house with young children in them. Others have serious damp issues that result in mould growing on walls so fast it needs removing on a daily basis.
The contractors drag the issues out for months on end despite daily complaints and when they do attend they either don't have the correct parts to fix the fault or it is only for a 15 minute appointment where the repairman is only authorised to carry out a "temporary" repair such as painting over the mould patch.

attributes.action: Bring Carer's Allowance rules in line with other working-age benefits
attributes.background: Carer's Allowance is payable at £62.10 per week, whereas Job Seekers Allowance is up to £73.10. Moreover, the eligibility threshold requires at least 35 hours of care provided. In contrast Working Tax Credit thresholds are 30 hours, and 16 hours for certain categories.
attributes.additional_details:
Carer's Allowance recipients have a higher hour threshold than workers, for a lower rate of benefit than Job Seekers. The rate of Carer's Allowance undermines the value of the work undertaken (estimated at £119bn per year - Carers UK and the University of Leeds (2011) Valuing Carers 2011: Calculating the value of carers’), and the additional expenses that caring can incur -  (Carers UK (2014) Facts about Carers).
CA should be £73.10 for 30 hours, and a lower rate introduced for 16 hours care.

attributes.action: Ban the Halal slaughter of animals.
attributes.background: The practice of Halal slaughter of animals is unjust and unnecessary as more humane methods are available. It causes pain and distress to the animals and must be stopped in the United Kingdom. Is it fair to promote groups such as the RSPCA to prevent animal cruelty when abattoirs nationwide do this?
attributes.additional_details:
To demonstrate the cruelty of Halal slaughter the following link will direct you to a distressing video: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZE2svQFH_q0&oref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DZE2svQFH_q0&has_verified=1

Therefore, I am petitioning the government to ban this outdated and barbaric practice.

attributes.action: MPs under investigation should not be allowed to sit in the House of Commons
attributes.background: MPs under investigation for election fraud should not be allowed to sit in the House of Commons. How is it possible for us to live in a democracy when our own MPs are not held accountable for their actions, and even if they are the police answers to the house so it's therefore a conflict of interest

attributes.action: Everyone on National Minimum Wage should receive the same wage regardless of age
attributes.background: I'm starting this petition simply because I and many others believe it is unfair that the Minimum Wage Rate rises in age groups. Why do under 18's get paid £3.90 less for working the same hours and carrying out the same job role as a 25+ year old?
attributes.additional_details: For example, I myself have been on minimum wage (under 18 wage rate) for just under a year. So if I decided to stay in this job role towards the future, I would have to wait 9 YEARS to receive FULL MINIMUM wage. What will I have done in 9 years of waiting for this wage? Yes, I may have more work experience. Yes, I may be more advanced and have more knowledge in this career. But I will still be working 42 hours a week doing the exact same job daily what I was doing at the age of 18, 9 years ago.

attributes.action: Transfer long term DLA claims to PiP automatically
attributes.background: People that have been claiming DLA for extended periods of time should be transferred automatically to PiP at the same or increased rate that they where receiving under the old system. They could then be re assessed on a paper assessment at a later date. This would free up the system lightening the
attributes.additional_details:
load on the DWP and negating the need to involve ATOS which is widely recognized as being not fit for purpose.
Re-diagnosing someone using under qualified inexperienced personal is a waste of tax payers money. The high volume of appeals won is testament to this fact. A clinical diagnosis is far more qualified than a practice nurse being paid by numbers. This gov. is wasting far more money trying to weed out the minority that would abuse the system than it saves by finding them.

attributes.action: Ban installation of Sound Limiters in all wedding venues (or increase the limit)
attributes.background: More and more venues are fitting (or are being forced to fit) sound limiters in a bid to appease local council noise restrictions. Whilst this can be good news for local residents living near the venue, it can wreak havoc on a live bands performance.
attributes.additional_details:
Most limiters have a noise restriction of 90-95 Decibels.

At this limit, loud applause can trigger the sound limiter.

When you consider a 5 piece wedding band will normally be in excess of 100 Decibels. A Big Band or Orchestra will be louder still. On top of this, if you consider the loudness of an audience or wedding party, accompanied by alcohol, the sound limiter limit is far too low. 
Please sign this petition to support the removal of Sound Limiters or a increase in sound level allowed

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers to declare and label their food halal or kosher
attributes.background: It is in the interests of the people to give them the information about what they eat so they can make an informed decision about the food they eat.  To deny this is denying peoples right to choose.  People have the right to know what they are buying and nothing should be hidden from the consumer.
attributes.additional_details: This work both ways, some people are strongly against the way in which animals are treated before their death and the way in which they are slaughtered.  They do not wish to have any part in the consumption of halal and kosher products.   However, the moslem community do support this and would probably feel better knowing that their food is slaughtered to "halal" guidelines and I am sure the Jewish community would prefer to buy products that are marked "Kosher".
